links.*: The Lord of the Rings: A Reader's Companion
The Lord of the Rings Appendices
The Tale of Aragorn and Arwen

wikitext.*:
'''Appendix A''' of ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'' contains historical background of the events in [[Middle-earth]] prior to the [[War of the Ring]].  Its main focus is on the [[Men|Mannish]] kingdoms of [[Númenor]], [[Gondor]] and [[Rohan]], and on the [[Dwarves]] of the line of [[Durin]].  It also contains ''[[The Tale of Aragorn and Arwen]]''.

==Contents==
*The Númenórean Kings
**Númenor <small>(A synopsis of the events of ''[[The Silmarillion]]'', especially the ''[[Akallabêth]]'')</small>
**The Realms in Exile <small>(A list of the [[kings of Arnor]] and [[Kings of Gondor|Gondor]], including the [[Chieftains of the Dúnedain]] and the [[Ruling Steward]]s of Gondor.)</small>
***The Northern Line: Heirs of Isildur
***The Southern Line: Heirs of Anarion
**Eriador, Arnor, and the Heirs of Isildur <small>(The history of the Northern Kingdom, through the time of [[Aragorn|Aragorn II]])</small>
**Gondor and the Heirs of Anarion <small>(The history of Gondor, including a few details of the lives of [[Denethor|Denethor II]], [[Boromir]], and [[Faramir]].)</small>
***The Stewards
**[[The Tale of Aragorn and Arwen]] <small>(Traces the love story of that couple, including their deaths.)</small>
*The House of Eorl <small>(The history of [[Rohan]].)</small>
**The Kings of the Mark
*Durin's Folk <small>(Focuses on the Dwarves of that line.  Some of the events leading up to the [[Quest of Erebor]] are given.  This section contains a family tree of Durin, including some details about [[Gimli]].)</small>
==Composition==
After finishing the book in [[1948]], Tolkien expanded further the Appendix A before publication around [[1950]], even after saying to [[Milton Waldman]] (who expressed interest in publishing the book) that he would try to cut the book's length.<ref>{{HM|RC}}, p. xxx</ref>
